nodes.text: Wally was a small, green-colored male frog kept as a pet by one of the residents of the first Death Star, which was officially known as the DS-1 Orbital Battle Station. At some point during the construction of the space station, Wally went missing aboard the Death Star, prompting its owner to offer through the HoloNet feed one hundred credits if anyone found and returned it to its caretaker.

Wally was first mentioned in the non-canon mobile game Star Wars: Tiny Death Star, which was developed by Disney Mobile in collaboration with LucasArts and NimbleBit and released progressively across several gaming platforms between October and November 2013. In the game, a HoloNet feed message from a randomly generated character known as a "bitizen" will occasionally appear, stating that the owner lost their frog and intends to reward the individual who finds it, although this is not an actual quest the player can undertake.
